intro: Rollinia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican star apple, is a tropical plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into round, fleshy fruits with a sweet, creamy flesh. The fruit is often eaten fresh or used in culinary applications. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
